Recall the infamous yet useful words of Donald Rumsfeld : [ T] here are known knowns; there are things we know we know. We also know there are known unknowns; that is to say we know there are some things we do not know. But there are also unknown unknowns- the ones we don't know we don't know. If you go looking for the known unknowns-the tiny asteroids that are undiscovered but statistically likely to exist-then you have a pretty good chance at building and sustaining an academic career. When you start seeking out unknown unknowns
